climbs.name: You Want Me to go Where?
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan and Jeff Brennan, August 2001

content.description: A left-slanting cracks leads to a ledge and then jogs right as it becomes a gaping off-width, which can be lie-backed or jammed, then pull a small roof and finish in a hand crack.
content.location:
A short ways to the right of

Think I'll Solo

.

climbs.name: Wish You Were Here
climbs.fa: (TR) Mike Rigney, Anthony Scalise, October 2001: First Lead: Eric Odenthal, October 2001

content.description:
Climb

Finger Licious

partway, and then move left diagonally to finish up a short headwall. Short but demanding with small holds and poor feet at the crux.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches, 3 bolts, bolted anchors
content.location:
Shares a start with

Finger Licious

on the left side of the face.

climbs.name: Too Many Beers
climbs.fa: Eric Tipton and Pat Brennan, August 2001

content.description: Climb a crack to it's finish under a small roof and jog left into another crack which leads to the top.
content.location:
Just right of

Look Out Below

.

content.description:
Climb a hand crack that widens to off-width about midway and finishes on the right side of a wedged block.

Despite the name it's not as bad as it sounds if you have some wide crack technique.
content.location: Just right of center is this prominent left-slanting wide crack.

climbs.name: What Would You Think of This?
climbs.fa: Anthony Scalise and Mike Rigney, October 2001

content.description:
Climb

Thrasher

to where it starts getting wide and move right and up the face past a large circular plate and other features to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches, 3 bolts, bolted anchors
content.location:
Starts on

Thrasher

and moves right.

climbs.name: Think I'll Solo
climbs.fa: Jeff Brennan and Pat Brennan, August 2001

content.description: Climb a right-slanting hand crack to a ledge and then continue up a right-facing dihedral.
content.location:
The next crack right of

What Would You Think of This?

.

climbs.name: Look Out Below
climbs.fa: Jeff Brennan and Pat Brennan, August 2001

content.description: Start up a wide crack in a right-facing corner and finish with a hand crack.
content.location: Furthest left route on the wall.

climbs.name: Finger Licious
climbs.fa: Eric Tipton, Jeff Brennan and Pat Brennan, August 2001

content.description: Takes a right-slanting line that undulates and concludes with moves past the left side of large wedged boulder at the top.
content.location: Just left of center and identified as the left side of a triangular block capped by a boulder.

content.description: Head up a dogleg thin crack that dies out and climb past a bolt that protects the crux moves to a finish past a wedged block.
content.location: Center of the east face up the middle of a triangular section of rock.
